comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: "Robert Edwin Peary (May 6, 1856 – February 20, 1920) was an American explorer who claimed to have been the first person, on April 6, 1909, to reach the geographic North Pole." From en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Peary Herbert Lawrence Bridgman was an organizer of the expedition and Secretary of the Peary Arctic Club. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_Lawrence_Bridgman and NYT article of September 17, 1909 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9802EED91F31E733A...

comment.author: 95787610@N00
comment._content: Look up Tom Avery's recent expedition in his footsteps: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Avery

comment._content: According to www.bowdoin.edu/arctic-museum/biographies/jpeary.shtml the children are Marie Ahnighito Peary (born 1893) and Robert Jr.
